metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000369 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Exim supports the use of multiple "-p" command line arguments which aremalloc()'ed and never free()'ed, used in conjunction with other issuesallows attackers to cause arbitrary code execution. This affects eximversion 4.89 and earlier. Please note that at this time upstream hasreleased a patch (commit 65e061b76867a9ea7aeeb535341b790b90ae6c21), but itis not known if a new point release is available that addresses this issueat this time.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
exim4-base - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
exim4-config - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
exim4-daemon-light - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
eximon4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.86.2-2ubuntu2.2').
